column4: good morning guys Im new to Ubuntu and I just taken win 7 off this pc and going to just use this Os on my pc.
Congrats.
Whats not working?
Nope, should work.
Click on it?  :)
What does the log say?
The path is /var/log/jockey.log, open it with an editor.
Really?
Do you have any experience logically thinking through a problem and solving it?
No flaming going on, just pointing out that the error message told you exactly what to do.
Are you installing fglrx over the open source drivers for a reason?  I use the open source ATI drivers and am mostly happy.
the open source ones are the ones already installed right?
Should be.
What ATI card do you have?
Sounds like a mobile card, is this a laptop?
Get the model number from lspci.  You can run "lspci |grep ATI" from the console.
Thats supported by the fglrx driver if you want to go that route.  Just gotta figure out why it's not installing.
if you could please help me sort this issue out I would be greatful
Why are you so hell bent on installing the fglrx driver?  Why not stick with the open source?
Have you read the community help wiki?  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RadeonDriver
Oops, sent you the wrong link.  Have you read:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI
